reviews.text: The grounds and facilities are top notch. The tennis facilities are remarkable with clay and even a grass court. The hotel was below average. There was a distinct smell and things were in disrepair. Response was very good however. They seemed to want to sell the upgrade and hinted that there would not be any Mayan Palace accomodations in the future. Parts of the Mayan Palace were being demolished. We did not upgrade and were treated respectfully. We had the best taxi driver---we had read about him and made contact and he was amazing. Personal pick up at airport---made a hotel reservation for us for one night, took us on a tour----he demonstrated his pride for his hometown--great english---can't say enough. Contact me if you don't get his info from someone else---Ismael. Also found a great guy doing fishing and boat tours. Would go back---hope there is a better Mayan Palace next time.
reviews.title: Mayan Palace Acapulco-Ismael taxi man
What's excellent...what's not.
reviews.text: My wife and I have been fortunate to travel to some beautiful parts of the world, but we have never taken the time to write a review. Ironically, it's not the place that we stayed at that has finally inspired us to write, but the amazing Alarcon brothers-Roberto and Benjamin. Everything good that you have read about these two is true--and more. You don't need to rent a car or deal with the Mayan's conceirge. These guys will pick you up and take you anywhere, in big, clean air conditioned Suburbans. Start by having them pick you up at the airport and the rest of your stay will fall into place. In no small part did they help make our vacation a very good one. They were a quick study on learning our likes and dislikes, and it took them no time at all to realize that we weren't the typical gringo touristas. They helped us plan our week accordingly. Not only did they make our dinner reservations at some of the best local cuisine restaurants (Su Casa, La Tortuga to name a few), but made sure we were seated at the best tables. If you want a feel for how the real locals party, have the Alarcon boys take you out to La Lomita for a real Mexican Festival. Not only was it one of the high points of the week, but 7 of us ate (the best grilled red snapper and camarones!) and drank and danced into the evening for $120 (including tip! Unlike the vanilla Festival at the Mayan that charges something like $68 p/p). It's important to add that they were very warm and friendly to our children as well. They were great with our kids. Benjamin taught our 7 year old daughter a wicked Mexican dance at La Lomita!
You can reach Roberto at --- or call from the U.S. at ---.
reviews.title: great vacation; fabulous driver!
Mayan Palace Acapulco
reviews.text: Don't miss the private one hour 'swim with the dolphins' at the Waterpark. It's pricey, but it is an hour you will never, ever forget.

As for the Mayan Palace...The grounds are beautiful. The food at the restaurants was good and reasonably priced. The staff was very pleasant. If you can't get up early enough to snag one of the palapa's on the beach, there are no shortages of umbrella's and chaises.
reviews.title: Mayan Palace, built to sell timeshares, but not for vacationers

reviews.text: The Mayan Palace is a gorgeous resort. We stayed the first week in April with my wife and our two kids. They loved the pools, especially the water park. THe kids club was nice so they could play with other kids while we soaked up some rays. The weather was beautiful (90 and sunny every day). I would recommend the taxi driver we had, Benjamin. He was great. I arranged to have him pick us up at the airport and we was only a cell phone call away if we wanted to go somewhere. He took us for an afternoon tour of the city ending with the nightly cliff diving show. I can give you his contact information if you would like. He speaks very good english and has an air conditioned suburban. We ate most meals at the resort. THe buffets were a little pricey. A couple days, we walked up to the Mayan Sea Garden and ate at that restaurant which is a little more affordable. The accommodations were a little outdated but we didnt spend much time in the room. The people were all very friendly. The resort is definitely away from the main drag as a taxi into town will cost $15-20 one way. But with kids, we didnt venture far from the resort. Overall, it was a great time.
reviews.title: Great Time
What a great spot
reviews.text: We were very fortunate to be able to spend a couple of weeks in this gorgeous place with the most wonderful beaches there are, I am sure. Our friends and ourselves did a fair amount of sight seeing thanks to the great driver we had. Angel Flores was everything that we heard he was from this site and so we were able to enjoy Taxco, the Cliff Divers, the many great restaurants and the fun tours. We loved Acapulco and the Mayan Palace, which we enjoyed as much as the one we stayed in when we were in the Cancun area, and we can hardly wait to go there again. We enjoyed the activities at the Mayan and the restaurants there and the grounds are wonderful. We stayed in the older section so there was some construction noises and the units aren't as nice as in the new section but the staff is very friendly and most helpful so it made for a most enjoyable time.

reviews.title: Bravo, Mayan Palace!
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Acapulco, first time at Mayan Palace. I have to say it´s the most family-friendly place I´ve ever visited. My husband, 8year old son and 6 year old daughter and I had the time of our lives. From a mom´s perspective, it was very kid-friendly. Only minutes after we arrived my son said, "Mom, this is the best vacation ever!"

It was a gift from my father-in-law. Our suite wasn´t huge, but it had a separate bedroom with king size bed for us, a full bath and kitchenette with sleeper sofas in the living room. There were two televisions, so the kids could watch one thing while we watched the news! The kitchen had everything-coffemaker, microwave, stove, toaster, blender and all the utensils and dishes we needed as well as a fridge. (Sorry, no oven.) Since we didn´t have much money budgeted for the trip, we bought an entire week´s groceries at the nearby Wal-Mart and saved a bundle in eating out. We went on the timeshare tour for a four-person water park pass and 25% off all food and beverages for the week (which we didn´t need because we didn´t purchase anything.) In fact, when we checked out, our bill was 18 pesos (about 1.75) for a bottle of water we used when we first got there before getting groceries. The pool wasn´t too deep (only 3 feet) and so I wasn´t as nervous about the kids. My son is a beginning swimmer but he could easily stand up in the pool. The beach was amazing-a true paradise. Two people we met there who had been to Hawaii told us it was remarkably similar. The waves were huge and the beach was very clean. (Watch out for the very strong undertow!) The sunset was the most spectacular one I´ve ever seen. There were many free activities-poolside-as well as a train tour around the grounds and free boats to tour the canals. The Kids Club, though we didn´t take advantage of it, looked really nice and was economical. They charge 20 dollars a day per child and it includes lunch and activities from 9:30 to 5:30. They did let us join them for a tour of the turtle camp. Over 100 sea turtles had just been born and we and the kids got to take them out of their nests and put them in sand boxes(they were only 8 hours old!) That night at about 2am they were going to release them into the ocean. We didn´t make it to that but it was a neat experience.
reviews.title: Unbiased Review of Mayan Acapulco
Great taxi driver really makes the trip very enjoyable!
reviews.text: There was also a stand dedicated to painting ceramics. At only 3.50 each it was a steal and the kids painted several to give to friends. (I have to admit I couldn´t resist and painted one myself to give to a friend.) It was in the shade and very relaxing!

reviews.title: Mayan Palace Acapulco
reviews.text: This is our fourth year returning to the Acapulco Mayan Palace. We are time share owners and find all the MP resorts first class, but this location has been our favourite. It is far from the madding crowds of Acapulco city, but close enough for a 20 minute taxi ride into the closer end of town for an evening meal (Linda Vista and La Tortuga among our favourites).

It is convenient to line up a good taxi driver from the start. We have used Benjamin Alarcon, who speaks good English and is very cooperative in terms of arranging reservations, etc. It's best to email him before you depart to arrange for a ride directly from the airport. Contact me for email information if you wish.
reviews.title: Mayan Palace not for everyone
Luxurious, Relaxing, Enjoyable Vacation
reviews.text: Meals on site are good quality, but fairly expensive. Also, service at the a la carte sites can sometimes be maddingly slow. The Walmart is 5 minutes away and carries groceries, so get Benjamin to run you in for supplies.

reviews.title: amazing mayan Acapulco
reviews.text: The main reason we always go to Mexico in March is the weather--we've never had a disappointment in over 15 spring breaks.

reviews.title: Loved the Taxi Service
reviews.text: Our family of five (2 adults and 3 teenagers) arrived at the Mayan Palace at 1:30 pm on Sat April 1st. Check-in wasn't that crowded but it wasn't clear. We were told where to go, but ended up waiting for 20 minutes in the check-in line for the Grand Mayan and then had wait another 20 minutes in the Mayan Palace line because of our mistake. Probably a miscommunication error but no signs and it wasn't obvious where to stand. Kind of time waster. We were not given the option of upgrading to Grand Mayan, only a 15% off voucher if we went to a breakfast. We opted not too. My time is worth more than 15% off drinks.

reviews.title: It's the little things, it's always the little things ...
reviews.text: Our family of four enoyed a nice week at the Mayan resort in mid-May. The Mayan Web site does a nice job of previewing the resort for you, but here are some tips about the Mayan and Acapulco that you won’t find there:

- We stayed in the Mayan Palace rooms (1 bedroom) which were perfectly fine – not plush, but just fine. They have no patios/balconies to speak of, however, and ocean views are hard to come by. The Grand Mayan rooms are much newer, but reminded me of Las Vegas –unnecessarily opulent and a little smaller than you’d want them to be. The suites, however, seemed plenty roomy and worth the upgrade. Rooms: B.
reviews.title: Tips for your Mayan Resort vacation.
Acapulco was great
reviews.text: - We followed the advice of many others here on Trip Advisor and contacted a driver before we left home, Benjamin Alarcon (----). This could not have turned out better as Benjamin truly made our week special by sharing his city with us. He arranged dinners, led a memorable city tour, translated our high school Spanish when we went shopping and, most important for us, was a special friend to our 5- and 1-year-olds. When we asked for "authentic Mexican fare," Benjamin offered up a couple of "secret locations" he know of .... great, great stuff. We heartily recommend him, his brother and their other drivers, as your means of getting around the city. By week’s end, Benjamin was a true part of our family, sharing Modelo’s and shrimp, and the both kids were sad when he dropped us off at the airport. Benjamin: A+.

reviews.title: Mayan Palace Experience
reviews.text: (I learned after arriving in Acapulco that there are many taxi drivers who also lead tours and offer private appointments. Advice: Stick with those recommended here.)

- At the Mayan Palace, you have access to all the same amenities as the Grand Mayan – pools, bars, restaurants, everything. They will pressure you hard to make a timeshare sales appointment – they may even offer you an upgrade to the Grand Mayan, food discounts, and water park admissions. Every morning and well into the day, we saw couples and families being led around by salespeople which suggested to me that the 90 minute commitment was really more like a “three-hour tour” … or longer. My experience with the salespeople was they were extremely inconsiderate to the hotel guests as they toured their flock about, or stood around smoking cigarettes outside the sales office refusing to move out of the way of a family with a stroller. During our week’s stay, we received three additional phone calls from the sales desk inviting us to the presentations. Timeshare people: F.
reviews.title: A hot Mayan Week
